meanings.definition: A style of dance that originated in the LGBTQ+ ballroom scene in the late 1980s.
meanings.sent1: At the dance competition, the participants showed off their voguing skills with grace and flair.
meanings.sent2: The voguing performance at the ballroom event was mesmerizing to watch.
meanings.sent3: During the talent show, Sarah attempted voguing but ended up tripping over her own feet.
meanings.sent4: The voguing dancers moved across the stage like elegant swans.
meanings.sent5: The art of voguing requires precision and creativity to truly shine on stage.

meanings.definition: To strike a pose or perform a dance move in a dramatic and exaggerated manner.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys voguing in front of the mirror, pretending to be a famous model.
meanings.sent2: The dancers voguing at the party drew everyone's attention with their energetic moves.
meanings.sent3: John couldn't resist voguing comically when his favorite song came on.
meanings.sent4: The trees outside were voguing in the wind, their branches swaying dramatically.
meanings.sent5: The actor voguing on stage captivated the audience with his theatrical gestures.
